title: Tropfest 2004 [DVD]
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Film festivals - Australia - Sydney - Awards
abstract: Book em (dir. Andelko Jurin, 5 min.)--Self serve (dir. Frazer Bailey, 7 min.)--Enzo (dir. Sam Worthington, 7 min.)--Sold out (dir. Luke Doolan, 3 min.)--Wild thing (dir. Eleni Arbus, 3 min.)--The Little woman (dir. Greg Williams, 7 min.)--Yin (dir. Costa Avgoustinos, 7 min.)--Chipman (dir. Annabel Osborne, 7 min.)--8 Pounds (dir. Michael Brown, 6 min.)--The Belfast boys (dir. Helen Toman, 7 min.)--Confessions of an animation (dir. Steve Baker, 4 min.)--The Money (dir. Gary Eck, 7 min.)--Summer angst (dir. Elissa Down, 7 min.)--For every year (dir. Glenn Stewart, 7 min.)--One down (dir. Gary Cunliffe, 6 min.)--Call me Al: a volunteer's story (dir. Antonio Orena Barlin, 7 min.)
description: Tropfest is the world's largest short film festival, held one night in February each year at the Domain, Royal Botanic Gardens, Sydney. The aim is to showcase work from young and emerging filmmakers, providing them with a festival atmosphere to screen their works to peers. This disc contains the sixteen 2004 finalists, the Awards Ceremony and Tips for budding filmmakers.
